definition: palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield
to control/to accuse/to charge/to sue/to invert a container to empty it/(suffix) (slang) buff/enthusiast/devotee/-phile or -philia

sentences.english: He also began to carry it out as soon as he took charge of FengXi warlord.
sentences.chinese: 在掌控奉系军阀统治权后，他也开始践行这一思想。

sentences.english: After three years, Deborah tried to break off the relationship and escape from Joshua.
sentences.chinese: 三年后，黛博拉试图结束这段关系，逃离约夏的掌控。

sentences.english: All the main channels are in effect controlled by the Kremlin.
sentences.chinese: 主要的新闻渠道实际由克林姆林宫掌控。

sentences.english: The Kennedy family occupies, for the moment, a place of equilibrium and purity.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪家族目前正掌控着一个和谐而纯洁的领域。

sentences.english: The money is handled by banks; staff do not touch it.
sentences.chinese: 这些钱有银行掌控员工不得碰它。

sentences.english: The Sulzberger family has had control of the “newspaper of record” ever since.
sentences.chinese: 该家族就此成了掌控报业的世家。

sentences.english: Accept there are some situations over which you have no control.
sentences.chinese: 承认确实存在某些情况是你无法掌控的。

sentences.english: Separate your desires from goals dictated by others.
sentences.chinese: 将你的愿望同由别人所掌控的目标相分离。

sentences.english: But he has not lost control of the upper-house Senate.
sentences.chinese: 但是他仍能掌控上议院。

sentences.english: Power of three helper locomotives into the hands of one engine crew .
sentences.chinese: 补机的动力掌控于一个乘务组之手。

sentences.english: And that brings luck out of the stars and, at least partially, into our grasp.
sentences.chinese: 这样就能使我们离幸运星更近，至少一半已在掌控中。

sentences.english: Up until that point, all programming languages developed by Microsoft were controlled solely in-house.
sentences.chinese: 那时微软开发的所有编程语言都由其自己独自掌控。

sentences.english: For McGrady, it'd be his shot at complete control over a team, with a plethora of sidekicks .
sentences.chinese: 对麦迪来说，他将完全掌控球队，并有一批好帮手。

sentences.english: The one controlling the results of the other, and viceversa.
sentences.chinese: 一方掌控着另一方的结果，反之亦然。

sentences.english: Help her learn to take charge of her own enthusiasms.
sentences.chinese: 帮她学会掌控她自己的积极性。
我们寻求一种客户掌控。

definition: to grasp (often fig.)/to control/to seize (initiative, opportunity, destiny)/to master/to know well/to understand sth well and know how to use it/fluency
initiative (as in "seize the initiative")/advantageous position that allows one to call the shots
to transfer/to maneuver (troops etc)/movement of personnel/to mobilize/to bring into play
to check and balance (power)/checks and balances
